c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:36): hi. i am having one FC5 server acting as a firewall and a few internal computers that access internet through the firewall. when the clients try to access some (not all) FTP sites they can log in but then the session dies. there is no difference wether active or passive ftp is used. i think this has to do with connection tracking, but i cannot remember. can some one point me to an example that would work on FC5?
9b989d6310db2d980c3c0f8c60da2fae (00:40): you have to add a module
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:41): is that done with help of modprobe?
9b989d6310db2d980c3c0f8c60da2fae (00:42): lsmod and see if its listed
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:42): ok, maybee one of the modules are missing... will check now. ill be back
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:44): there seems to be quite a few of them...
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:48): i try to load the following modules in my firewall script, all load well manually:
d949efae795da71ef603b60b018d191c (00:48): i guess ip_conntrack is just an indication that the module was loaded properly
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:50): are there any good working examples out there on how to set up ftp forwarding on an firewall host?
c0b2f4cd2878adfb568b77c0b3ec51dd (00:50): maybee some of the modules are in conflic on my system?
